intro: Stephanodaphne pedicellata, commonly known as the creeping bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to southern Africa. It features small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue, typically blooming in spring. The plant has a low-growing habit with opposite, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. The genus Stephanodaphne is part of the Campanulaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with showy, bell-shaped blooms.
